name: Benefits of Insurance Riders
content: Benefits of incorporating riders into insurance policies

steps.name: Customization
steps.content: Insurance riders offer policyholders the flexibility to customize their coverage based on specific needs and circumstances. They allow policyholders to tailor their insurance coverage to meet their unique needs, adding specific protections without purchasing a separate policy.

steps.name: Additional Protection
steps.content: Riders provide additional layers of protection beyond the basic coverage, addressing specific risks or scenarios that may not be covered in the standard policy. This makes them a cost-effective way to enhance coverage by paying for only the additional benefits needed.

steps.name: Life Event Customization
steps.content: Policyholders can choose from a variety of riders to customize their policy according to life events, such as marriage, childbirth, or changes in health. This offers flexibility, allowing policyholders to adjust their coverage as their circumstances evolve without purchasing a new policy.

steps.name: Financial Assistance
steps.content: Certain riders, such as the accelerated death benefit or critical illness rider, provide financial assistance in specific situations like terminal illness or the diagnosis of a covered critical illness. These riders provide financial security in times of need.

steps.name: Guaranteed Insurability
steps.content: Riders like the guaranteed insurability rider enable policyholders to increase their coverage in the future without undergoing additional medical exams or proving insurability. This ensures policyholders can increase their coverage when needed.
